page.title: 07St.Peter's Church Ipsley.
page.content: {St. Peter's Church Ipsley}is on a hill to the east of Arrow valley in Redditch. St. Peters church is an ancient church. We believe there was a church in Anglo-Saxon times because {Domesday Book}mentions a priest .The present church was built in the{14th {Century in the Decorated style.}It is made of red sandstone.It has a western tower with small turrets.The entrance is on the southern side. The double doors are made of oak studded with iron.Inside there is a nave and chancel.The side aisles have been blocked up.To the north of the altar are alabaster slabs with effigies of the{Hubaud family of Ipsley Court}Near the chancel arch is a rare septagonal 14th Century font. Other features include a lectern with a brass eagle and a Jacobean pulpit. Contact the Rector at nearby Ipsley Rectory.
